data.title: Big Banks Unlikely to Increase Mortgage Offers to First-Time Home Buyers
data.description:
Big banks are not expected to significantly increase mortgage offerings to first-time home buyers facing financial challenges. Wall Street Journal (Markets) posted on X, highlighting that despite some improvements in the housing market, large financial institutions remain cautious. 

The reluctance stems from ongoing economic uncertainties and regulatory pressures that make banks wary of expanding their mortgage portfolios. Additionally, the current interest rate environment and potential risks associated with lending to financially unstable buyers contribute to this cautious approach.

While there is a demand for more accessible mortgage options, banks are prioritizing risk management over aggressive lending strategies. This cautious stance is likely to persist until there is greater economic stability and clarity in regulatory policies.

First-time home buyers may need to explore alternative financing options or wait for more favorable conditions as big banks maintain their conservative lending practices.

data.title: Binance Wallet Integrates New dApps Including Torch Finance and Rezerve
data.description:
Binance Wallet announced on X the integration of several new decentralized applications (dApps) into its platform. The newly added dApps include Torch Finance, Rezerve, Maiga, Ember, Planck, Balance, Bean Exchange, Coral Finance, BigPump, and TBook. This expansion aims to enhance the user experience by providing a broader range of financial tools and services.

The integration of these dApps is part of Binance Wallet's ongoing efforts to offer diverse options for its users. Torch Finance and Rezerve are among the notable additions, providing users with innovative financial solutions. Other dApps like Maiga and Ember are expected to offer unique functionalities that cater to different user needs. By incorporating these applications, Binance Wallet seeks to provide a more comprehensive ecosystem for its users, allowing them to explore various financial opportunities within the platform.

This development reflects Binance Wallet's commitment to expanding its offerings and improving accessibility for its users. The inclusion of dApps such as Planck, Balance, and Bean Exchange further diversifies the platform's capabilities, enabling users to engage with a wide array of financial services. As Binance Wallet continues to grow, the addition of these dApps signifies a step forward in enhancing the platform's utility and user engagement.

data.title: China to Remove Tariffs on Canadian Agricultural Products
data.description: China announced it will eliminate tariffs on Canadian rapeseed meal and lobsters, aiming to alleviate disruptions in agricultural trade. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting this development following Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit in January. This move is expected to improve trade relations between the two countries and benefit Canadian exporters.

data.title: MARA Holdings Reports Significant Financial Losses in 2025
data.description:
MARA Holdings has reported a net loss of $1.31 billion for the full year of 2025, following a net profit of $541 million in 2024. According to ChainCatcher, the company's revenue increased from $656.4 million to $907.1 million during this period.

In the fourth quarter, MARA experienced a net loss of $1.71 billion, with a diluted loss per share of $4.52, compared to a net profit of $528.3 million and a diluted earnings per share of $1.24 in the same quarter the previous year.

In terms of production, MARA mined a total of 8,799 bitcoins in 2025, with 2,011 bitcoins mined in the fourth quarter alone. By the end of 2025, the company held 53,822 bitcoins.

The company attributed the fourth-quarter net income impact to a $1.5 billion negative change in the fair value of digital assets and digital asset receivables. Over the past six months, MARA's stock has declined by 46%.

data.title: ThomasLloyd Climate Solutions to Merge with Blank-Check Company for U.S. Market Entry
data.description: ThomasLloyd Climate Solutions has announced a merger with a blank-check company, facilitating its entry into the U.S. market for powering data centers. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the strategic move aimed at expanding ThomasLloyd's operations and influence in the renewable energy sector. The merger is expected to enhance the company's capabilities in providing sustainable energy solutions to data centers across the United States. This development marks a significant step for ThomasLloyd in its mission to promote climate-friendly energy practices globally. The agreement underscores the growing importance of sustainable energy in the tech industry, particularly in the operation of data centers, which are known for their substantial energy consumption. By entering the U.S. market, ThomasLloyd aims to leverage its expertise in climate solutions to meet the increasing demand for green energy in data center operations.

data.title: Germany to Reduce Support for Rooftop Solar in Favor of Larger Solar Parks
data.description: Germany's economy ministry is set to reduce its support for rooftop solar installations, shifting its focus towards larger solar parks. Bloomberg posted on X that this strategic move aims to enhance the country's renewable energy infrastructure by prioritizing larger-scale solar projects. The decision reflects a broader effort to optimize energy production and efficiency as Germany continues to transition towards sustainable energy sources. This policy adjustment is part of the government's ongoing commitment to meet its renewable energy targets and reduce carbon emissions.

data.title: Bharat Biotech's Vaccine Portfolio Includes Covid-19 and Hepatitis B
data.description: Bharat Biotech, a prominent biotechnology company, offers a range of vaccines, including those for Covid-19 and hepatitis B. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the company's significant contributions to public health through its vaccine development efforts. Bharat Biotech has been at the forefront of vaccine innovation, particularly during the Covid-19 pandemic, providing critical solutions to combat the virus. The company's hepatitis B vaccine also plays a vital role in preventing the spread of this infectious disease. Bharat Biotech continues to focus on research and development to enhance its vaccine offerings and address global health challenges.

data.title: MARA Q4 2025 Financial Report: Net loss of $1.7 billion, announces partnership with Starwood to develop AI business.
data.description: MARA released its Q4 2025 financial results, reporting a 6% year-over-year decrease in revenue to $202.3 million and a net loss of $1.7 billion, primarily due to the decline in Bitcoin prices. The company also announced a strategic partnership with Starwood Digital Ventures to develop AI and high-performance computing infrastructure. As of the end of 2025, MARA held 53,822 Bitcoins (worth approximately $4.7 billion), and its energy hashrate increased by 25% year-over-year to 66.4 EH/s. The company stated it will continue its transformation from a pure Bitcoin mining business into an energy and digital infrastructure company and plans to expand its operations globally.

data.description: On Feb 27, 2026, 10:12 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has dropped below 67,000 USDT and is now trading at 66,954.59375 USDT, with a narrowed 2.42% decrease in 24 hours.

data.description: On Feb 27, 2026, 10:12 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has dropped below 620 USDT and is now trading at 619.840027 USDT, with a narrowed 1.49% decrease in 24 hours.

data.title: Britain's Flood Insurance Strategy Shifts Towards Capital Markets
data.description: Britain's flood insurance program is set to increasingly depend on capital markets to manage flood-related losses. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the country's strategic move to bolster its financial resilience against natural disasters. This shift aims to enhance the capacity to handle potential claims arising from severe flooding events, ensuring a robust financial framework. The initiative reflects a broader trend of integrating capital market solutions into traditional insurance models, providing a diversified approach to risk management. As climate change continues to pose significant challenges, this strategy underscores the importance of innovative financial mechanisms in safeguarding against environmental risks.

data.title: Nvidia's Strong Quarter Highlights AI Infrastructure Spending
data.description: Nvidia has reported an impressive quarter, achieving $68.1 billion in revenue, driven by significant growth in its Data Center segment. According to NS3.AI, this performance underscores the ongoing narrative of increased spending on AI infrastructure. Bitcoin's price is currently mirroring the sentiment in the tech sector, functioning as a leveraged proxy for risk appetite linked to AI-related optimism or concerns. Upcoming reports on AI regulation and safety, especially from Anthropic, have the potential to introduce volatility, affecting both technology stocks and Bitcoin in various ways.

data.title: Poland Emerges as Top Beneficiary of EU's SAFE Funding
data.description: Poland has become the largest recipient of the European Union's SAFE funding, aimed at supporting economic recovery across member states. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting Poland's significant allocation from the fund, which is designed to bolster economies in the wake of recent challenges. The funding is part of the EU's broader strategy to ensure stability and growth within the region, providing financial assistance to countries most in need. Poland's allocation underscores its critical role in the EU's economic landscape, as the country continues to navigate the complexities of the current economic environment. This development is expected to have a positive impact on Poland's economic recovery efforts, contributing to the overall resilience of the EU's economy.

data.title: Michael Pollan Explores Consciousness in New Book
data.description: Michael Pollan's latest book delves into the enigmatic realm of consciousness, offering readers an engaging exploration of what it means to be a bat, a plant, or even oneself. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the book's unique approach to unraveling the mysteries of consciousness. Pollan's work transforms this complex subject into an unexpectedly joyful journey, inviting readers to ponder the nature of awareness and existence. Through his insightful narrative, Pollan encourages a deeper understanding of consciousness, making it accessible and intriguing for a broad audience.

data.title: Japan Reports Zero Forex Intervention in Early 2023
data.description: Japan's Ministry of Finance has announced that the country's foreign exchange intervention amount was zero yen from January 29 to February 25, 2023. According to Jin10, this period saw no active measures taken by Japan to influence its currency's value in the forex market. The report highlights Japan's current stance on foreign exchange activities, indicating a lack of intervention during this timeframe. This announcement comes amid ongoing global economic fluctuations and currency market dynamics.

data.title: Berkshire Hathaway's PacifiCorp Faces Legal Challenges Over 2020 Oregon Wildfires
data.description: Berkshire Hathaway's utility company, PacifiCorp, is facing significant legal challenges due to the extensive damage caused by the 2020 wildfires in Oregon. Bloomberg posted on X that the company has been actively pursuing legislative measures across various western states to redistribute the financial burden of wildfire damages. This move comes as PacifiCorp seeks to mitigate the financial impact of the court rulings against it. The legal battles highlight the ongoing struggle between utility companies and the increasing frequency and severity of wildfires in the region.

data.title: Cryptocurrency stocks were mixed in pre-market trading in the US, with BMNR rising 1.13%.
data.description: According to data from msx.com, pre-market performance of crypto stocks in the US market was mixed. BMNR rose 1.13%, SBET fell 0.28%, MSTR rose 0.67%, CRCL rose 0.06%, and COIN fell 0.03%. msx.com is a decentralized RWA trading platform that has listed hundreds of RWA tokens, covering US stock and ETF tokens such as AAPL, AMZN, GOOGL, META, MSFT, NFLX, and NVDA.

data.title: Matrixport deposited 750 BTC worth $50.89 million into Binance.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens, Matrixport deposited 750 BTC worth $50.89 million into Binance.

data.title: Figure Reports Significant Financial Growth in 2025
data.description:
Figure, a blockchain capital markets company, released its financial report for the fourth quarter and full year of 2025. According to BlockBeats, the company saw a substantial increase in its consumer loan market transactions, reaching $2.7 billion in the fourth quarter, marking a 131% rise compared to the same period last year. Net income for the quarter grew by 91% year-over-year, with adjusted net income increasing by 106% to $158 million. Net profit surged by 156% to $15 million.

For the entire year of 2025, Figure's net profit rose by 574% to $134 million, while net income increased by 49% to $507 million. The consumer loan market transactions for the year totaled $8.4 billion, reflecting a 63% growth.

Additionally, Figure's board has authorized a stock repurchase program, allowing the company to buy back up to $200 million of Class A common stock and blockchain common stock over the next 12 months.

data.title: Sui Group Holdings Reports 2025 Financial Performance with Significant Losses
data.description:
Sui Group Holdings, a Nasdaq-listed company, has released its full-year operational performance report for 2025. According to Foresight News, the report reveals a net loss of $221.8 million in the fourth quarter of the previous year. As of February 23, the company increased its holdings of SUI tokens to 108,368,594, with nearly all tokens staked, generating an average daily yield of approximately 5,000 SUI.

Additionally, the company disclosed the completion of a stock repurchase plan, previously approved for $50 million, resulting in the buyback of 7,801,042 shares of common stock. This accounts for 8.8% of the issued common stock.
